content: prism socks 1 50 gm skein 215 yds lorna s laces socknitter s rainbow yarn color b 1 50 gm skein 205 m stahl socka dark navy yarn color a us size 1/2 5 mm dps or size required to obtain gauge tapestry needle gauge 33 sts and 46 5 row = 4 ins/10 cm in st st note socks can be made with any number of sts that are a multiple of 4 abbreviations wyib with yarn in back aitp as if to purl ridge check pattern minor variation of b walker s ridge check pattern round 1 2 color a *k 3 sl 1 wyib aitp repeat from * to end round 3 color a k round 4 5 color b *k 3 sl 1 wyib aitp repeat from * to end round 6 color b k cuff co 64 w/ color a join being careful not to twist k2 p2 rib for 2 5 ins join color b work in ridge check for 4 5 ins or desired length of cuff end with row 1 or 2 continue with color a slipping color b for another 16 sts note this is to bring color b into position for the gusset divide for heel put half 32 sts aside for the instep purl back using color a on 32 heel sts heel flap worked only in color a knitting back and forth on 32 sts work the following 2 row 16 times row 1 *sl 1 k 1 repeat from * to end row 2 sl 1 p to end turn heel row 1 sl 1 k 17 sl 1 k 1 psso k 1 turn row 2 sl 1 p 5 p 2 decrease p 1 turn row 3 *sl 1 k 1 repeat from * to 1 st before end of row 1 there will be a gap between these sts and the remaining ones sl 1 k 1 psso k 1 turn row 4 sl 1 p to 1 st before end of row 2 sts again there will be a gap here p 2 decrease p1 turn repeat row 3 and 4 consuming 2 additional sts from across the gap on each row until all sts have been incorporated into the heel the slipping of every other st on the rs row creates a eye-of-partridge effect gusset rs k across the heel sts pick up 16 sts along side of heel flap work 32 instep sts in ridge check pattern picking up with the next row of the pattern pick up 16 sts along other side of heel flap arrange work on needles as follows half of heel sts + 1 gusset on 1 needle instep sts divided on 1 or 2 needles remaining gusset + other half of heel sts on last needle note in working the gusset and foot the entire round is worked in either color a or color b based on which color is used in the ridge check pattern
